channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8010] TestMetaMigrationConvertingToPB failing on trunk and 0.95
item.description: No stdout/stderr, just complaint that region is not online.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Turn on ipc debugging so we hopefully spill the buffer. The test is failing on jenkins without dumping stdout/stderr so hard to know what it is failing. Also added a wait for table before we start in on the scan. See if we fail there. Let it go through hadoopqa first. Might dump out what we need there so won't have to commit.

On private jenkins, this tests passes every time as it does when I run it locally (this morning it was failing for me but it was a networking issue, not this test).
This was only test that failed on https://builds.apache.org/view/G-L/view/HBase/job/HBase-TRUNK/3916/testReport/
This might be related to HBASE-7928

I can reproduce test failure locally:

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12572204/8010.add.debug.txt
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.catalog.TestMetaMigrationConvertingToPB
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.TestMasterFailover
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.TestSplitTransactionOnCluster

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/4681//testReport/

@Stack:
I am trying to find out why IPC version was incorrect.

TestMetaMigrationConvertingToPB failed at second iteration in trunk.

When I back out TestMetaMigrationConvertingToPB, it loops for 7 iterations successfully.

Will update if I find out something.
Will check this out now.
It does not fail for me when run locally with eclipse and in linux box.

Continuously looping the test to observe failure.
Stack
The precommit build in this JIRA has failed with no IPC logging from the patch. This is something to do with the region movement and assignment i feel.

org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.RetriesExhaustedException: Failed after attempts=10, exceptions:

Finally one run failed and i got this.

For region 'TestTable,row3,1344396125329.8fbc1d4a633f0c1e73f879c8489a8d79.', changeStartAndStopRowIfMeta() changes


[84, 101, 115, 116, 84, 97, 98, 108, 101, 44, 114, 111, 119, 51, 44, 49, 51, 52, 52, 51, 57, 54, 49, 50, 53, 51, 50, 57, 46, 56, 102, 98, 99, 49, 100, 52, 97, 54, 51, 51, 102, 48, 99, 49, 101, 55, 51, 102, 56, 55, 57, 99, 56, 52, 56, 57, 97, 56, 100, 55, 57, 46]

to:


[84, 101, 115, 116, 84, 97, 98, 108, 101, 44, 114, 111, 119, 51, 44, 49, 51, 52, 52, 51, 57, 54, 49, 50, 53, 51, 50, 57, 46, 56, 102, 98, 99, 49, 100, 52, 97, 54, 51, 51, 102, 48, 99, 49, 101, 55, 51, 102, 56, 55, 57, 99, 56, 52, 56, 57, 97, 56, 100, 55, 57, 46, 44, 44, 48, 48, 48, 48, 48, 48, 48, 48, 48, 48, 48, 48, 48, 48]

Here is call stack:

HTable.getScanner(Scan) line: 533

Thanks Ted. So let me check whenever it passes what happens and when it fails what happens..

Ted,
Here as per the patch as we checked for ",," it is appending ,,00000000 at the end. For all rows.
May be we can just check if there is a ','. And update the patch.
But i feel the problem is different may be and not related to this.

Patch that checks for the occurrences of two commas where they don't have to be adjacent.

Looping TestMetaMigrationConvertingToPB now.
ramkrishna.s.vasudevan Your failure is a local networking issue, not hbase. Ted Yu What are you suggesting?
My patch is not generating enough content to force a flush. No point committing it.

I think with this may be the 0.94 TestMetaMigrationRemovingHTD may pass.
Patch looks good.

Your failure is a local networking issue, not hbase

Stack, what i feel is, As per the code the new RS should be updated for the migrated rows. And it should hit that new RS which is the currently running machine.
But that does not happen when this failure happens and the META tries to still hit the old RS which is like hardcoded to simulate this migration behaviour.
Correct me if am wrong.
Ted Yu Why does the patch make sense? Why do we have to have this at all? If it is HBASE-7928, revert. Why is this kinda fix up only required in one place and not throughout the code base?

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12572277/8010-v2.txt
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/4694//console

This message is automatically generated.
-1 on this since HBASE-7928 was reverted.
If the tests pass again after revert, suggest this be closed as 'Invalid' or 'Wont Fix'
Fixed by revert.
